newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EIB grants Belgian Sabena 3.6 bln Bfr loan.
newsitem.headline: EIB grants Belgian Sabena 3.6 bln Bfr loan.

text.p: The European Investment Bank (EIB) is granting Belgian national airline Sabena SA a 3.6 billion Belgian franc loan to renew and expand its short- and medium-range fleet, Sabena said on Friday.
The contract for a first tranche of 1.2 billion francs was signed on Friday, it said.
"This financing will contribute to the purchase of the Avro RJ85 and RJ100 used for the transport of passengers on the regional European network from and to Brussels," it said in a statement.

"The fact that a European institution wants to put money in our company is a sign of confidence towards our shareholders," Sabena spokesman Erik Sclep said. "It means our accounts and financing are being appreciated. This is important for Sabena."
Sabena, 49.5 percent owned by Swissair, ordered 23 82-seat Avro RJ85 jets from British Aerospace Plc in September 1995 to modernise its European regional fleet.
Thirteen of them are operational and one more will be delivered later this year. Nine 100-seat Avro RJ100 planes will be delivered by 1999.
"Creating a uniform fleet (23 RJ85s, 6 BAE-146s and 28 Boeing 737s on the European network) allows Sabena to expand its hub and spoke network," Sabena said in a statement.
It said the first contract worth 1.2 billion francs was signed by Sabena chief executive Paul Reutlinger and EIB vice president Rudolph de Korte.

Sabena said de Korte underlined the importance for EIB of supporting projects such as Sabena's, "projects which enlarge mobility and inter-regional integration within the framework of the European Union by developing performant communication".
